# Descriptive Calculations

## Building the pipeline

New script, clear your environment, re-load your libraries


~~~
library(tidyverse)
~~~
{: .language-r}


~~~
tumor_subset <- read_csv("../data/tumor_filtered.csv")
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~

── Column specification ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
cols(
  Group = col_double(),
  ID = col_double(),
  Day = col_double(),
  Size = col_double()
)
~~~
{: .output}


~~~
tumor_subset
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~

## Summary statistics


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  filter(Day == 0) %>%
  pull(Size)
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
 [1] 41.8 79.4 44.8 67.7 54.7 60.0 46.8 49.4 49.1 60.6 41.5 46.8 39.5 53.5 43.5
[16] 64.4 47.5 71.7 44.1 42.1 42.5 56.9 46.7 51.2 44.0 59.8 40.7 58.2 41.3 53.5
[31] 45.8 48.2 47.7 69.2 43.9 59.3 51.1
~~~
{: .output}


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  filter(Day == 0) %>%
  pull(Size) %>%
  mean()
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
[1] 51.59189
~~~
{: .output}


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  filter(Group == 1, Day == 0) %>%
  pull(Size) %>%
  mean()
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
[1] 55.575
~~~
{: .output}


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  filter(Group == 2, Day == 0) %>%
  pull(Size) %>%
  mean()
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
[1] 51.81
~~~
{: .output}


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  filter(Group == 3, Day == 0) %>%
  pull(Size) %>%
  mean()
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
[1] 48.62
~~~
{: .output}


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  filter(Group == 4, Day == 0) %>%
  pull(Size) %>%
  mean()
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
[1] 51.11111
~~~
{: .output}


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  pull(Group) %>%
  unique()
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
[1] 1 2 3 4
~~~
{: .output}

## Groupby operations


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  filter(Day == 0) %>%
  group_by(Group) %>%
  summarize(avg_size = mean(Size))
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
# A tibble: 4 x 2
  Group avg_size
  <dbl>    <dbl>
1     1     55.6
2     2     51.8
3     3     48.6
4     4     51.1
~~~
{: .output}


~~~
tumor_subset %>%
  group_by(Group, Day) %>%
  summarize(avg_size = mean(Size),
            sd_size = sd(Size),
            q1 = quantile(Size, probs = .25)
            )
~~~
{: .language-r}



~~~
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Group'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
~~~
{: .output}



~~~
# A tibble: 8 x 5
# Groups:   Group [4]
  Group   Day avg_size sd_size     q1
  <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>
1     1     0     55.6   12.9    46.3
2     1    13   1597.   764.   1030. 
3     2     0     51.8   10.6    44.3
4     2    13    453.   287.    357. 
5     3     0     48.6    7.30   42.9
6     3    13    934.   510.    571. 
7     4     0     51.1    8.64   45.8
8     4    13    768.   314.    600. 
~~~
{: .output}
